adjective.description: Relating to or denoting a group of North American peoples formerly inhabiting the Midwest, or their languages.

noun.description: A member of any of the Caddoan peoples.
The family of languages spoken by the Caddoan peoples, which includes Pawnee and may be related to Siouan and Iroquoian.

origin: From Caddo (a language of the Caddoan family) kaduhdacu, denoting a band belonging to this group, + -an.
